Privacy Policy of Mail helper

Last modified: December 29, 2018

Mail helper operates on Fireabse web hosting: https://fir-playgrounds.firebaseapp.com. Mail helper is: Web mail client. Application that allows users to read or send email meta data via an user interface.

Application type

Mail helper is an Applications that enhance the email experience for productivity purposes

Terms of service

The terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions, which is accessible at https://fir-playgrounds.firebaseapp.com/terms.html, unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy.

Why I've been working on this tool ?

Each day my mailbox receives a lot of emails. To reduce my reading time I've been using a lot of labels (at this moment I have 500+ diffferent labels).

Structure data

I'd like to introduce a term "on the stage": structure data. Structure data - email message has at least one label.

I created this tool because I'd like to increase my productivity. First version creates a filter and label (if this is necessary !!!).

Additional feature is: User can setup label background and text color.

I'd like to explain which Gmail REST API scope that is required by my application:

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly

My application will use https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly to retrieve information about Gmail labels and filters.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.labels

Without this permission application CAN'T create a Gmail label

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.settings.basic

This permission will be used ONLY to create a new Gmail Filter

If you want to understand more about gmail scopes and privacy of your information, please visit: Gmail scopes

Application workflow / Lifecycle

Authorization

When an user opens this application for this first time will see a simple button with name: "Authorize". Buttons is responsible to create a web token. Web token is able to read gmail meta data, access label meta data and manage basic mail settings.

Application has an authorization access

If applications has this web token, application loads form that contains these sections:

  • Label name
  • Filter name - User could choice to use the same keyword for filter and label name
  • Label visibility - User can choice three options:
    • Label to be always hidden
    • Label always to be visible
    • Label to be visible if contains at least one email with is waiting to be read
  • Label colors - User can specific label background and text color
User wants to create a new filter and label (if this is necessary !!!)
  • If algorithm finds a label and that label name is equal to keyword -> tool ONLY creates a new filter.
  • If gmail label meta data doesn't have an information about this keyword -> Application creates label and filter.

What this applications stores ?

Application stores json web token after authorization

Application creates an unique web token. If browser has a browser cookie that contains this token and token is valid: Authorization is not required by application.

Application is using a background task to "copy" information about label meta

Application creates an application variable. This application variable contains an information about Label meta data.

Why applications need this ?

My application filters this variable related wit desired keyword. If keyword exists -> Application creates filter and label at Gmail

What this application doesn't do

  • Our service doesn't delete or update your label meta data.
  • Our service doesn't delete or update your filter meta data.
  • Our service doesn't access other mail settings
  • Our serice doesn't shares a data with other applications !!!

Hosting

I chose Firebase because this service provides https sertificate. Https provides an encrypted connection between browser and server. This connections DOESN'T allow something to sniffing web trace and "steal" your web token. If you want to learn more about firebase please visit: Firebase hosting

Children's Privacy

This services requires your age to be at least 13 years old. We required this because we want application to be a compatible with COPA
